direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY CATALEYA RESTREPO, CAT for short, a contained, very centered 10 year old, pretty, but with a toughness, sitting at the dining room table, in a well kept, but modest home, with windows that look out over the steep hillside favela, attends to her notebook. On the window there are half a dozen beautiful orchid plants. The rare Cataleya orchid. All around there are packed cartons, suitcases. Moving day is at hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cat! Is your homework finished yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working on it Mama. Her mother, taking time off from packing, comes over to Cat, and turns the page of the notebook to reveal the Lara Croft comic and it's copy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero. Her mother turns the page back to the lessons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better to be a doctor. A lawyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we going to see Uncle Emilio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father. Cat looks up at a picture on the wall of the family. Cat, her mother, and her father. Her face carries a bit of worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe this. Mid 40'S, a gentleman, calm, courteous, impeccably dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DON LUIS'S GARDEN - DAY At a table, with bottle of liquor and two glasses, Don Luis sits opposite...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? Cat's father. Off to the side, Don Luis's right hand man,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands like any right hand, unobtrusive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother. He turns to Marco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you believe this guy Marco? We started when we were little...how old were we Fabio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market. After all we've been through. And now we're on top, he wants to leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was last year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you'll take a rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how many times we should have been dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even want to count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither do I. But you gotta think. How lucky we are to still be alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That's right. We're alive. And what about the future of this thing we built?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's yours. It's not my thing any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll always be there for you Luis. Just pick up the phone, I'm there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard. (EMOTIONAL) I'm going to miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm going to miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh? He pours the liquor into the glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They tap glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bueno. They shoot the liquor down. Fabio rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Business is all clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All clear. He hands Don Luis a computer disc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No other copies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You even have to ask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. He shrugs. Opens his arms. The two men embrace. Close as brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best. And with that, Fabio exits the garden. Don Luis watches him, sad to see his friend go. Sighs deeply, pours himself a whiskey, downs it, turns to Marco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill this motherfucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two men, holding automatics in their laps sit in the back, the driver in the front. They see Fabio very contained, calm, walking towards them. The driver turns the engine on. Fabio slips into the passenger seat. The car takes off. Fabio explodes. Smashes the dashboard. Over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fucker! The motherfucker! He keeps banging the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not OK Boss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This bastard thinks I'm an idiot. Playing it all mellow and shit. If he would have yelled and screamed and threatened to kill my whole family, it would have been OK. We have an hour to get out of here. At most. Off the nervous looks of the guys in the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY Fabio's car comes to a screeching halt. Fabio exits to three other gunmen, nervous, on edge. The gunmen from the car take defensive positions. Fabio runs up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY Cat is still at the table drawing, when she hears the screeching of tires, the fast footsteps outside. She senses a storm coming. Fabio bursts in. His wife sees his tension filled face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fabio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got ten minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cataleya, go pack!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm packed Mama. Cat is strangely calm, just sits at the table. Watches as Fabio takes the family picture off the wall, pries the frame back, extracts a small chip hidden inside the frame, comes over to Cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This... He holds the chip up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your passport. Do you understand? She nods. He places the chip in her hand, takes a card out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find yourself alone? You go to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember. As Cat looks at the chip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY As Fabio's men keep a sharp lookout, two SUV's come rolling down the street. Their fingers work the triggers of their weapons. The two SUV's roll up. The blacked out windows roll down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (polite. smiling) Hola. We want to see Don Fabio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind if we wait?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY Fabio writes on top of Cat's drawing, rips the page off, folds it, puts it in her pocket, removes a medal from around his neck, drapes it over hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this will keep you safe. Cat looks down at the medal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An imprint of a flower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place. My mother, your grandmother, used to grow them. Every morning I would wake up to the sight of them. The smell of them. That's why I named you after them. It reminds us of who we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He kisses her on the forehead. His wife appears at the doorway with two suitcases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY The man in the SUV is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said he's not home yet. He listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OK. He hangs up. Puts his phone back in his pocket. Walks up to Fabio's men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change of plans. He pulls out his gun, shoots them point blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAT'S HOME - DAY As they are exiting the house through a rear door, the shots ring out. They see another black SUV rushing up the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back! He pushes his family back inside. Fabio runs to the window. Sees his men on the losing end of a gun battle. As the men fall, and others run up the stairs firing as they retreat toward the front door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. Get ready! The Mother drops the suitcases and runs to the rear room. Fabio comes over to the unnaturally calm Cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches under the table where Cat is sitting, takes a gun strapped there. Next to the gun is a big knife. And then footsteps, coming fast outside, draw his attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alicia! His wife runs into the room toting two big assed assault rifles. She tosses one to Fabio. Both of them take up shooter's positions facing the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting at the table, very still. Watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Facing the front door, hands gripping their assault rifles, sweat dripping down their faces, chests heaving, waiting, waiting, to blow anyone who comes through the door to kingdom come. But they never get the chance because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!!!!! Machine gun fire shatters the windows on both sides of the room, tearing into their bodies before they even get one shot off. Tearing the orchid plants there to shred. Cat watches in mute disbelief, shocked, as her parents bodies are riddled with heavy caliber rounds making them twitch and dance like marionettes on wires. Their blood splattering across the room, across her. And then... Silence. Silence so complete it is deafening in it's absence of any sound. Cat just sits in her chair. And then the door bursts open and four gunmen storm into the room, their assault weapons trained on the only living thing in the room. Cat. Marco enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back. The gunmen scatter. Marco has his inquisitive eye on Cat, who does not drop her eyes, impossible to read. One of the GUNMAN strides over to Cat, jams a gun to her head. Cat does not move a muscle. Does not blink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Examines the frame Fabio dug the chip out of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He chambers a round, is about to pull the trigger...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! What are you doing? As the other gunmen begin to tear the house apart, looking for something, Marco strides over to Cat. The frame in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don Luis said kill everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He also said no names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She won't remember. He is about to pull the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The gunman stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value. The gunman takes his gun, lifts Cat's lip, looks at her teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street. The gunman is about to pull the trigger again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you stupid or what? Here. Marco hands him some cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job. Scowling, the gunman joins the others in ripping the house apart, looking for something. Marco calmly goes to the fridge, takes out two bottles of water, cracks the caps, sets one down on front of Cat as he sits opposite her. Her hands are in her lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember me Cataleya? Cat shakes her head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal. Alluding to the medal around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cataleya orchid. His symbol. Your name. That's good. This way you will always remember him. (BEAT) I know this is a terrible thing for you to have seen. All the while his men are searching, frisking the bodies of the dead, even tearing the heels off their shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand. Now, you know who Don Luis is? Cat responds, shakes her head yes. Her hand slips imperceptibly under the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touches the handle of the knife taped there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you. You know he has always been good to your family, don't you? Again Cat shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that? Again Cat shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like... He alludes to the riddled bodies of her dead parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This. Cat looks from the bodies and back to Marco, no emotion in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right? Cat nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than... He holds up his thumbnail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This. Maybe it was in this. He holds up the frame, shows where the chip was dug out of the wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what I am talking about? Cat nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gripping the knife handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. Do you know where it is? Cat nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if you don't give it to him, he will be very unhappy. And you see what happens when he is not happy, yes? Cat nods yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him. Will you do that? Cat hesitates for a moment, and then removes one hand from underneath the table, her fist closed tight. Marco smiles, kindly. He holds out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a smart girl. Marco opens his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat? And just as she is about to open her hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under the table, gripping the handle of the knife taped there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want? In a flash, the knife is whipped out and buried into Marco's unsuspecting, open palm. Driven with such force, the knife pierces through the back of his hand, and sticks into the table beneath; pinning his hand. Marco wants to scream but there is so much pain, nothing escapes his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in his ear) To kill Don Luis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!! The men searching look up, and before they can react, Cat races past them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As she runs through the rooms of the house, sprints to the bathroom where one foot hits the toilet, springing her onto the ledge of a very small window. As she looks back, she sees the gunmen in hot pursuit. And she jumps, head first. Barely squeezing her small frame through the tiny window. And she drops... Six feet down, onto a ledge, that is just beneath the window. She flattens against the wall, holding onto the medal of her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the gunman comes to the window, cannot fit through, looks out, does not see anybody across, then hears something beneath him, looks down, sees the tip of a shoe below. Puts his gun out the window, points it down, and....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!!! Lets loose with a barrage from his weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She watches as the bullets split the cement all around her feet. Coming inches from ripping into them. And then the barrage stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His clip runs out. And as he fumbles to slam another one in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hears the pause. Looks out over the sprawl of houses that stretch up and down the steep hillsides of the favela. She looks down at her open palm at the small chip her father gave her. Pops the chip in her mouth, swallows, leaps over the small divide between her house and the next roof, and takes off running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gets the clip to fit, sees Cat heading off across the roof, out in the open, exposed, vulnerable. He lifts his gun to shoot, when the gun muzzle is slammed up, peppers the ceiling with bullets. The gunman turns to Marco, holding his bloody rag wrapped hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need her alive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cat leaps from one rooftop to another, shinnies down a drain pipe onto another roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jumping down from the window of Cat's home, start to sprint across the roof in hot pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She drops down to another roof, this one filled with a vegetable patch, where an old man is gardening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marco exits Cat's house, wrapping his bloody hand tightly with a piece of his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! Go! He orders four more gunmen who have just zoomed up on motorcycles. The souped up rice rockets take off in four different directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she comes off the last rooftop, down into a small alley. She sprints across to a small door. She kicks at the door, which gives way and enters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where a half dozen women are doing laundry by an open tap. They look up to the sight of this little girl in the blood splattered school uniform, do not say a word. And neither does Cat. She just runs through to a small gate on the far side of the courtyard, opens it, and disappears. One of the women casually hangs one of her wet sheets over the gate, hiding it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They crash through the vegetable garden. The old man deftly kicks a rake leaning against the wall. It falls in between the rows of tomato vines. When the gunmen sprint through, the first one trips over the rake, goes crashing through the vines, which causes the two men behind him to also trip and fall. The fourth man hurdles his fallen cohorts, bounds over the roof. And the fifth man, looks at the old man. Knows what he has done. Shoots him dead before jumping off the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She races down a steep hill in the crowded favela streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They enter the laundry yard. The women don't even look up. The gunmen look around, just see laundry hanging from the fence, do not see the hidden door. Race back out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She runs down a steep alley, filled with people sitting outside their homes, chatting, playing dominoes. At the end of the alley, two motorcycles appear. The riders see Cat, as she sees them. They turn their bikes into the alley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! And bear down on Cat. Cat sprints back up the hill. She goes to escape into one of the open doors, but she finds that one after another the doors have closed shut, the people fled inside. The bikes eat up the hill. Cat's legs are no match for them. It seems she will be caught any second. She ducks down a street where laundry is hung on a concealed metal pipe running the length of the alley. As Cat ducks through the sheets the gunmen gun their bikes right towards her, tear through the sheets...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AND THE CONCEALED METAL PIPE CATCHES THEM ACROSS THEIR THROATS

direction.raw_text: She looks back, to the dead gunmen, disappears over the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Marco, in an open top jeep, with three of his gunmen ON BOARD, comes rolling up the road. He sees Cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There! The jeep screeches around. Cat dashes down an alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she runs up the alley with it's open sewers running on either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The alley is too narrow for the jeep. The men spill out, spring up the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She runs up the alley, then ducks down another one. She comes to a ladder that leads up a fence, begins to climb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running up the alley, turning into the next one. Where they see the ladder. One of the gunmen pulls out his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the jeep, scouting as it rolls along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is running for all she is worth, out of breath, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More thugs on bikes, on foot, in cars. They are everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is leaning against a wall on a rooftop, gulping air, when she hears the roar of engines. Looks over the side of the building to see dozens of gunmen flooding the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing the ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hearing them coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surrounding a building. Throwing grappling hooks onto the roof ledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing the grappling hooks claw onto the roof edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cresting the roof from the ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rappelling up the side of the building on the grappling ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flooding onto the roof from both sides. Coming to the spot where Cat was only moments before. To find no Cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . One of the gunmen takes out his cell. Dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets! Marco slams his phone shut. Heads for his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North! The gunmen clear the roof. As the last one leaves, he takes one last suspicious sweep of the roof, cannot figure where this wisp of a girl went to. His eyes briefly focus on the chimney...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. He clambers over the side of the roof.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE CAMERA STAYS FOCUSED ON THE CHIMNEY

direction.raw_text: Cat, holding her breath, listening keenly to the sound of the men departing, is wedged into the chimney, her hands and feet clinging like a lizard to the walls on either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cat comes over the top of a hill, the soot of the chimney, mingled with the blood of her parents, staining her dress. The doors and windows all along the street are shuttered tight. Her eyes search the curb as she makes her way down the street. When she hears the sound of a vehicle. She looks up to a jeep turning the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the windshield of the jeep, staring at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got her! Close the net!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sees Marco. She pauses for a moment, and then does something that stuns even Marco. She starts to run right towards the jeep!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A bit stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is she doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She keeps sprinting toward the jeep. Another jeep appears over the hill behind her. Starts to come at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As his jeep speeds right for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she runs, her eyes go to the right, and it becomes apparent she knows exactly what she is doing. She has a plan. And she executes it. Suddenly, she leaps for the curb and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sees Cat dive to the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she wriggles her skinny little body down the grate, with barely enough room to squeeze in. But in she does squeeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In total disbelief, watching her disappear down the narrow slit in the curb. Both jeeps pull up. The men jump out. Marco flattens to the street, peers into the grate, sees Cat staring up at him. Marco takes his gun out. Jams it in the grate...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!! Empties his clip into the dark. When he runs out of ammo, he peers down again. Cat is gone. The gunmen run to the next sewer grate fire into that one. Marco looks down, no Cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get down there! The gunmen rip the grate out, jump down the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunmen, following the beams of their flashlights, go tramping through the muck of the sewers, trying to find Cat. The only living things they find are rats, scurrying across their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We lost her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! FUCK! He kicks every car in the street in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunmen wait in the sewer, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O. Come back out. The gunmen retreat back the way they came. They do not see someone watching them go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small crevice in the sewer wall. Cat has squeezed herself into the crack, almost invisible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars and trucks rumble along a busy thoroughfare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand emerges. And then, Cat pulls herself out, into the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands at the edge of the busy thoroughfare, and looks around. She is in the heart of the city. Where tall office buildings, compete with graceful, classical mansions. In the distance, she sees the hillsides, covered with the twinkling lights of the favelas, two miles, and a world away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two Marines stand guard. Looking straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Marine looks down to Cat. Bedraggled, covered in soot and blood and shit. Holding out the card her father gave her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EMBASSY OFFICE - NIGHT The American looks at the card Cat gave to the Marine, hands it to another American.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you say you have something for us? He turns to Cat, who nods yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I see it? Cat takes a beat. Puts her fingers down her throat. And throws up all over the man's desk.
direction.name: direction

She takes a spoon from the coffee cup left for her, reaches into her mane of hair and extracts a small pin. She inserts the pin into the keyhole of the door, jiggles it. The door pops open. Cat exits the cell, takes a broom leaning in the corner, and keeping her eye on the camera above the door, she slides along the wall, until she is just under the camera. She uses the broom handle to tilt the camera up just a bit.

direction.raw_text: . ELECTRICAL ROOM - NIGHT Cat stands on a narrow shelf, undoes the last screws on a vent in the ceiling with a screwdriver from the tool board on one wall. Cat drops down, opens the electrical control panel on the wall, studies it for a moment, finds the switch she is looking for, then turns to the wall of tools, plucks some wire, a cutter, a spring. Cat sets to work on a jury rigged mechanism with the items at hand. When she is finished, she tugs at the waist band of her mini skirt, and little by little she stretches a thin dun colored leotard suit over her whole body. She takes a small plastic vial, fills it with some water from the tap, and sets it, just so, above the device she has constructed. The device is hooked to the switch she selected, a small weight hangs from the bottom of it by a wire. She sets the water container just so over the spoon from her cell. The water begins to drip a drop at a time. She closes the panel door, sets her digital watch. Hoists herself up to the vent in the ceiling, and is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water dripping into the spoon a drop at a time.

direction.raw_text: Once inside the grate, Cat takes one of the buttons off her blouse and presses the top of it. The button becomes a pin light, which she clasps between her teeth, starts to crawl on her stomach, pulling herself along by her elbows and her wriggling hips and knees, the light still between her teeth.

direction.raw_text: As she moves through the maze of ducts. On the way, she peers through the grates in each ceiling, down into one cell after another, catching various views of inmates asleep as she passes over them. As he approaches the front door, Richard looks over to see two more guards, off to the side. He nods to them, knows them. They nod back. Richard approaches the front door, knocks. direction.raw_text: Cat enters a completely bare bones dwelling, there is nothing that identifies the person who lives here. White bare walls, a table with one chair, a single bed. Along one wall, a cabinet. On the window sill a single Cataleya orchid. Cat waters the orchid. Cat opens the cabinet to three computer screens. Two of them are divided into quarters and show various views of the building entrance, the lobby, the stairway, the elevator, the hallway. The third screen is dark, until Cat hits a button and music fills the apartment. Music with a heavy sensual back beat. French Rap. Ooh la la. And the screen pulses and glows in time to the beat. Cat's body responds to the music, moving sexy, her shoulders rolling, her hips swaying.

She enters the shower. Turns on the water. Like a snake shedding a skin, she lets the water divest her of everything that came before.

direction.raw_text: Cataleya? Cataleya!
